quoteFirst: Rogers was arraigned upon five indictments, and Street upon two. The trials began
quoteLast: and ended about two in the afternoon. Rogers was tried upon the three first indictments, and being found guilty on all three, the Court thought it unnecessary to proceed upon the other two.
title: The Parochial History of Cornwall, Volume 1 (of 4)
author: Gilbert, Davies, 1767-1839 [Editor]; Boase, Henry S. (Henry Samuel), 1799-1883 [Contributor]; Hals, William, 1655-1737? [Contributor]; Tonkin, Thomas, 1678-1742 [Contributor]

quoteFirst: This somewhat staggered the cavalry in pursuit, but they soon recovered, and some smart skirmishing took place on our retreat to the boats, which all the time maintained a well-directed fire on the enemy, keeping them in check, so that we got clear off with the loss of one seaman only—a gallant fellow named Hogan—who was blown up and terribly shattered, in consequence of a cartouch box buckled round his waist having exploded while setting fire to the trains. We otherwise arrived safe on board
quoteLast: , somewhat fatigued by the night’s adventure.
title: The autobiography of a seaman (volume 1 of 2)
author: Dundonald, Thomas Cochrane, Earl of, 1775-1860; Earp, George Butler [Compiler]; Jackson, William, active 1784?-1862 [Contributor]

quoteFirst: It was quickly discovered, however, that the cruisers were our own. Shortly after, therefore, breakfast was piped to each watch in turn, and at
quoteLast: the enemy's ships were actually sighted. From this time on to close upon 2 P.M., successive actions were fought between various opposing forces of the two fleets.

quoteLast: on Monday, July 18th, after breakfast, intending to visit Waima (Maiva) _viâ_ Bereina; but at Inawi we received an urgent message from Yule Island that the _Alice May_ had arrived there, and would sail on the 19th. This necessitated our giving up the much-desired visit to Waima, and returning instead to Yule Island.
title: Head-hunters, black, white, and brown

quoteLast: that we entered into a tavern--if so it could be called. A servant-maid and child were the only people up. We gave ourselves out as French travellers from Prussia going into France, and who wanted their breakfast.

quoteLast: , when the rays of the sun begin to emit some degree of warmth, the diving commences. quoteLast: on the 26th the shelling began, and there was a lot of sniping from the village at my right rear. Presently I saw about sixty Germans, who had been hiding, bolting across our rear, and I think, between our fire and the German shelling, they must have been wiped out. Then the shelling got terrific, absolutely all over us. At one time for two consecutive minutes I counted over sixty shells a minute bursting within fifty yards or so of my trench.
title:
The Childrens' Story of the War, Volume 3 (of 10)

quoteLast: , after a good night’s repose and an excellent breakfast, we resumed our journey; the air was keen, but not so piercing as on the previous evening, and the sun shone brilliantly. The road we had passed, and the one we were still upon, are excellent; the new road is a great improvement.
